item.title: Bootstrapping and its Implementation in R
item.description: About Empirical Bootstrap (a.k.a Nonparametric Bootstrap) What is bootstrapping sample and how to generate it? Letâ€™s take median as a parameter of distribution of our interest What is it for? Difference between real world and bootstrap world Empirical CDF Why does it work? Parametric Bootstrap References About This page is to provide a gentle introduction of Bootstrapping and its application in R and Python. I make my own summary of the materials related to the topic and the reference is provided in the end.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
